body_content.explanation: an occasion on which a group of soldiers stand together in a formal arrangement in order to be given instructions before they start work:
examples: The soldiers were required to assemble for guard mount 15 minutes before the beginning of their work shift.
The garrison faced a daily diet of guard mount, drill, inspections, cleaning of weapons, and other routine chores.

body_content.explanation: a ceremony in which a group of soldiers replaces the soldiers who have finished their time on duty standing outside an important public building:
examples: Men are at their posts until the guard mount the following morning.
The guard is changed daily at 11.30am in a ceremony known as Guard Mounting.
